Text:
Great great movie.  
Welles as Harry Lime is the most fascinating anti-hero of the screen.
Alida Valli is simply beautiful, both her and her character.  The last scene, when she walks past Cotten is a complete metaphor of love wrapped in few masterful frames.  
I am dling this one since the quality looks better than the copy I have.  
Thank you, Pippin

One of my all-time favourites - thanks, mate. It's - in my opinion - probably the best movie ever made when it comes filming.

... and it's got one of the best quotes in movie-history:

"In Italy for 30 years under the Borgias, they had 
warfare, terror, murder, and bloodshed, 
but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci, 
and the Renaissance. 
In Switzerland they had brotherly love - 
they had 500 years of democracy and peace, and what did that produce? 
The cuckoo clock ..."

-- Harry Lime (Orson Welles), The Third Man
Great work Pippin! terrific work so far in this series, I'm looking forward to the next releases!
Can anyone come and seed The Lady From Shanghai, stuck at 99%
Thanks so much! I've been looking for this movie for years.
You are all doing a great job guys, keep it up!
please keep seeding!!! im almost done
Not a Welles film but a great film none the less. Thanks.

excellent quality video and sound.
awesome film. i'd give it 10/10
Thanks, looking forward to seeing this piece of movie history.
Thanks a lot! One of the best movies ever and surely the best movie of the 40's!
Thans a lot for this great film!!
great copy! thank you very much
